title: Ahrefs
shortDescription: Industry-leading SEO toolset for backlink analysis, keyword research, and competitive intelligence. Drive organic traffic to your e-commerce store.
longDescription: Ahrefs is the gold standard for SEO professionals and e-commerce marketers who want to dominate organic search. The platform maintains one of the largest backlink databases in the industry, crawling over 8 billion pages daily. For cross-border sellers, Ahrefs reveals exactly how competitors rank and what strategies drive their organic traffic. The Keyword Explorer provides accurate search volumes and keyword difficulty scores across 170+ countries, essential for international SEO. Site Audit crawls your website to identify technical SEO issues hurting your rankings. The Content Explorer helps you find proven content ideas by analyzing what performs well in your niche. Rank Tracker monitors your positions across multiple search engines and locations. For e-commerce specifically, Ahrefs excels at finding product-related keywords with commercial intent and analyzing competitor product pages. The tool integrates with Google Search Console for enhanced data accuracy. While the learning curve is steeper than some alternatives, Ahrefs' data quality and depth make it indispensable for serious SEO efforts.

faqs.question: How much does Ahrefs cost?
faqs.answer: Ahrefs offers Lite at $129/month, Standard at $249/month (most popular), Advanced at $449/month, and Enterprise at $14,990/year. The Lite plan is limited but sufficient for small sites. Annual billing saves 2 months. No free trial, but they offer a 7-day trial for $7.

faqs.question: Is Ahrefs better than Semrush?
faqs.answer: Both are excellent. Ahrefs has superior backlink data and a cleaner interface. Semrush offers more features including PPC tools, social media, and content marketing. For pure SEO and link building, many prefer Ahrefs. For all-in-one marketing, Semrush may be better.

faqs.question: Can Ahrefs help with Amazon SEO?
faqs.answer: Ahrefs is designed for Google SEO, not Amazon's A9 algorithm. However, it's valuable for driving external traffic to Amazon listings, researching product keywords people search on Google, and building authority sites that link to your Amazon products.
